result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Follow assessment recommendations.
Follow rules and pay fees of supervision.
No contact with children under the age of 18, except current roommates children. 
No contact with children under the age of 18, without prior approval of probation agent.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by CALLING the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, to set up an appointment during the hours of 8:00 a.m. - 4:00. p.m. Monday through Friday, at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.
Early termination of probation, at agent's discretion, upon successful completion of conditions and no further law violations.

timeConds.notes: imposed and stayed (consecutive with huber).  Jail time may be imposed in whole or in part at the discretion of the agent, upon filing an affidavit with the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
With good time.  With huber if in compliance with jail facility regulations. Transfer authorized to Outagamie County Jail.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.
